Computer_Science_8_r$Computer_Science_12.text:
Finding A: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding B: "This leads to the possibility that a spatial virtual memory palace -- experienced in an immersive virtual environment -- could enhance learning and recall by leveraging a person\'s overall sense of body position, movement and acceleration," Plaisant says.
Finding C: "You\'d expect them go the opposite direction: At first, picking important things but then there are diminishing returns in those experiments, so over time they\'d shift to more risky experiments, choosing things further from each other in the network," said Evans.
Finding D: It seemed that the longer someone had been driving a taxi, the larger his hippocampus, as though the brain expanded to accommodate the cognitive demands of navigating London\'s streets.

Finding A: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding B: "This leads to the possibility that a spatial virtual memory palace -- experienced in an immersive virtual environment -- could enhance learning and recall by leveraging a person\'s overall sense of body position, movement and acceleration," Plaisant says.
Finding C: "You\'d expect them go the opposite direction: At first, picking important things but then there are diminishing returns in those experiments, so over time they\'d shift to more risky experiments, choosing things further from each other in the network," said Evans.
Finding D: It seemed that the longer someone had been driving a taxi, the larger his hippocampus, as though the brain expanded to accommodate the cognitive demands of navigating London\'s streets.

Finding B: Note that, although for large networks such high computational cost makes this solution often unfeasible, for criminal networks constituted (most often) by hundreds or at most thousands of nodes, this algorithm works well.
Finding C: This result suggests that observing physical phenomena (along with mixed reality feedback on whether child predictions and physical results match) may enhance learning and enjoyment.
Finding D: Finally, professionals in the Western region of the United States were less accepting of mobile phone use during meetings.

Computer_Science_131_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: We believe this is a first step in using virtual environments for creating more memorable experiences that enhance productivity through better recall of large amounts of information organized using the idea of virtual memory palaces.
Finding B: Our study provides a tantalizing glimpse into what may lie ahead in virtual-environment-based tools to enhance human memory.
Finding C: The integration of #computational models & the #neuroscience of #vision holds promise for vision science, but small numbers of images in biological experiments are a challenge. The BOLD5000 dataset from @username is a step towards a solution.
Finding D: When compared to women, men are almost twice as likely to find things like texting or answering calls appropriate in an informal meeting: USC There's also a massive difference based on age.

Finding A: We believe this is a first step in using virtual environments for creating more memorable experiences that enhance productivity through better recall of large amounts of information organized using the idea of virtual memory palaces.

Finding C: The integration of #computational models & the #neuroscience of #vision holds promise for vision science, but small numbers of images in biological experiments are a challenge. The BOLD5000 dataset from @username is a step towards a solution.
Finding D: When compared to women, men are almost twice as likely to find things like texting or answering calls appropriate in an informal meeting: USC There's also a massive difference based on age.

Computer_Science_tweet_144_r$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: University of Maryland researchers conducted one of the first in-depth analyses on whether people recall information better through #VR, as opposed to desktop computers.
Finding B: Core #language skill in typically and atypically developing #children, including those with #autism spectrum disorders, is stable from infancy to adolescence. This suggests that when a child’s language skills are lagging, early intervention is best @username
Finding C: The second laws of #quantum thermodynamics @username #physics
Finding D: Many of the participants said the immersive "presence" while using VR allowed them to focus better.

Computer_Science_tweet_102_p$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: Each label type reduced lunch calories by approximately 10%.
Finding B: Across both measures of online program engagement, we find that ads spur more online purchases when they air in more social shows, with funny ads spurring the largest increases in sales when they air in more social shows and with active and informational ads generating the smallest increases in sales.
Finding C: Per a study on @username website, 20% of duplicate tests were not clinically indicated.
Finding D: "This is preliminary work, and it needs to be more thoroughly tested, vetted and replicated before we can safely claim that an algorithm can truly identify markers of depression in Instagram posts," Reece said.

Finding B: Across both measures of online program engagement, we find that ads spur more online purchases when they air in more social shows, with funny ads spurring the largest increases in sales when they air in more social shows and with active and informational ads generating the smallest increases in sales.

Computer_Science_189_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: With the new research, scientists can definitively say that London taxi drivers not only have larger-than-average memory centers in their brains, but also that their intensive training is responsible for the growth.
Finding B: Saying "Excuse me" to take a call didn\'t cut it: over 30 percent still found it to be rarely/never appropriate during informal/offsite lunch meetings.
Finding C: The authors concluded that training in the virtual and real-world environments likely used similar cognitive mechanisms.
Finding D: A sufficient degree of tax incentives, or sufficient additional advantages coming from customers, regulators, or investors, would make social incentives comparable to financial incentives.
Computer_Science_189_r$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: With the new research, scientists can definitively say that London taxi drivers not only have larger-than-average memory centers in their brains, but also that their intensive training is responsible for the growth.
Finding B: Saying "Excuse me" to take a call didn\'t cut it: over 30 percent still found it to be rarely/never appropriate during informal/offsite lunch meetings.
Finding C: The authors concluded that training in the virtual and real-world environments likely used similar cognitive mechanisms.
Finding D: A sufficient degree of tax incentives, or sufficient additional advantages coming from customers, regulators, or investors, would make social incentives comparable to financial incentives.

Computer_Science_tweet_71_r$Computer_Sci.text:
Finding A: @username & @username researchers propose an interesting adaptive approach to improving deep brain stimulation for #Parkinsons using motor cortex sensing\n
Finding B: Figure 6b illustrates how one can visualize this heterogeneous hemodynamic landscape in Tumor 1 by www.nature.com/scientificreports www.nature.com/scientificreports/ mapping each vessel class onto the underlying microvascular network.
Finding C: When groups are forced to go head-to-head with each other, we expect those composed of men to exhibit higher levels of creativity relative to groups composed of women.
Finding D: We show that, at the aggregate level, the airlines that began charging for one checked bag saw a significant relative improvement in their on-time departure performance in the 35-day period afterwards, compared to the airlines that were not charging for a checked bag during the same time period.
